english.segment1: I love you more than a slow-falling summer rain. More than a silence that only the snow leaves behind. I love you more
english.segment2: And I love you better than the gray of the autumn air. Better than spring in its blooming against the sky. I love you more
english.segment3: It may not be red as the roses yet. It may not be strong as the old oak trees but. Love planted deeply becomes what it ought to be
english.segment4: Your love is steady and sure as the mountains high. Moving my heart like a river that gently bends. Your love is sure
english.segment5: Your love is wide open spaces where I can run. And yet, we're tangled up roots in the warm broken earth. Yeah, our love is sure
english.segment6: And it may not be clear as the morning yet. It may not be wide as a restless sea but. Love given freely becomes what it ought to be
